title: A Christlike Heart: A Study of the Heart in the Book of Mormon
features: The Book of Mormon includes 442 references to the heart—a much higher frequency per verse than what is found in the other standard works. In this book, scripture scholars Ryan and Derek Squire identify the conditions of the heart that the prophets of the Book of Mormon teach us about as well as the ways we can have our hearts changed to be more like the Savior’s. Follow their analysis, personal examples, and teachings to
Discern between pride in our eyes and pride in our hearts.
Discern between pride in our eyes and pride in our hearts.
Avoid slippery treasures of today that cause our hearts to be set upon riches.
Avoid slippery treasures of today that cause our hearts to be set upon riches.
Identify four characteristics of a mighty change of heart.
Identify four characteristics of a mighty change of heart.
Discover the blessings of a broken heart and a contrite spirit.
Discover the blessings of a broken heart and a contrite spirit.
Repent with full purpose of heart.
Repent with full purpose of heart.

There is a natural progression and flow to the conditions of the heart taught within the Book of Mormon, and there is no shortcut to developing our hearts to be like the Savior’s to receive exaltation. These are the steps we must take to have our hearts properly sanctified and purified to enter back into His presence.
